course.subject: ECON
course.name: Green Finance and Sustainability
course.description: This course discusses the application of finance in addressing contemporary environmental issues, such as pollution and climate change. Topics include the fundamental theories of environmental economics, strategies for a green economy and sustainable business, as well as related legislative and regulatory frameworks. The course also covers cases regarding the environmental impacts on asset prices, such as real estate prices and stock market performance, and discusses the challenges in public finance in the setting of sustainability. Students will learn basic financial tools to navigate environmental risks as an investor, an asset manager, or a regulator.
course.prerequisites: ECON 3113 OR ECON 3014
